Race.SpecificTitle: Eastover Neigh. Imprv. & Sec. Dist. -- Annual $1,652 Parcel Fee - CC
Race.SummaryText: Eastover Neighborhood Improvement and Security District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy in perpetuity an annual flat $1,652 "Eastover Neighborhood Improvement and Security District Fee" on each parcel of land (including condominium parcels) within the Eastover Neighborhood Improvement and Security District, which is comprised of that area within these boundaries: northern boundary is the northern boundary of Eastover Subdivision, southern boundary is Dwyer Road, eastern boundary is I-10 Service Road, and western boundary is Jahncke Canal (except, conditionally, the property at 5690 Eastover Drive), provided that when a single family dwelling occupies multiple adjacent parcels, the flat fee shall be 1.4 times the single parcel fee for two adjacent parcels and 1.6 times the single parcel fee for three or more adjacent parcels, commencing January 1, 2014, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $495,600 annually, to be used exclusively (except 1% city collection fee) to promote and encourage the beautification, security and overall betterment of the District as determined by the Board of Directors of the Eastover Property Owners Association; any additional law enforcement or security personnel provided by the District shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Twinbrook Security District -- Parcel Fee - CC
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy an increase in the currently authorized annual flat $500.00 "Twinbrook Security District Fee", on each parcel of improved land (except parcels owned by individuals who qualify for "special assessment" as provided in Article  VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Louisiana Constitution) within the Twinbrook Security District (which is comprised of that area within the following perimeter: Jefferson Avenue (lower side only) to Danneel Street (both sides) to Valence Street (both sides) to Prytania Street (both sides) and back to the lower side of Jefferson Avenue), as specified by City Council Substitute Resolution R-13-243, to a flat fee not to exceed $575.00 annually per parcel of improved land for eight (8) years, commencing on January 1, 2015, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $300,000 for one entire year, to be used solely and exclusively (except 1% City collection fees) to promote and encourage security of the Twinbrook Security District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Twinbrook Security District, which additional security provided by the District shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: East N.O. Neigh. Adv. Comm. -- $5 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: East New Orleans Neighborhood Advisory Commission Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual East New Orleans Parcel fee, on each improved or unimproved residentially zoned parcel of real property situated within the boundaries of the East New Orleans Neighborhood Advisory Commission (ENONAC) (which is comprised of that area whose boundaries are the Industrial Canal to the west, the Intracoastal Canal to the south, the St. Tammany Parish line to the east, and Lake Pontchartrain to the north), as specified by Substitute Resolution R-13-298 of the City Council in the amount of five dollars ($5) for four (4) years, beginning January 1, 2014 and ending December 31, 2017, to be used exclusively (except 1% city collection fee) for ENONAC's purpose and benefit to encourage and promote the beautification, economic growth and overall betterment of East New Orleans, which fee is estimated to generate approximately $385,000 for one entire year?
